comments.commentBody: Trump is facing complex, deadly serious stuff like the North Korean nuclear missile threat ( see today's article, "Trump Inherits Cyberwar vs. North Korea" ). But he is incompetent AND mentally unstable. God help us all.
It's just another one of Trump's hiccups. Deflect, deflect deflect. That is all he does. he probably did the same thing when he was a child in order to get out of trouble. It's tiresome, really.
Trump is a little league political player. What difference does it make if his phones were tapped? Now he's President and Obama is not. He really is so little.

How ironic that President Trump, who decries anonymous leaks from within the government, never discloses the sources of information he uses to smear his political opponents, including the most ethical president in modern American history.  On second thought, how typical.
Could be Obama thought like everyone else that Clinton had it in the bag.

This is a typical Trump diversion. Sessions had to recuse himself. The Russian connection issue is getting hotter. So come up with some tweets that are so outrageous that attention is drawn away from the difficult issues. How dare he malign President Obama!
I believe he is certifiably crazy. Watching this new administration over the past 6 weeks would be funny if it wasn't so dangerous.

Wow, what a difference from Tuesday night to now. Get used to this. My guess is we'll see much more of his regular behavior; Tuesday night was an anomaly. Teleprompters tend to have a calming influence.

Teleprompters have a calming influence on 45 because he struggles to read.  Notice the cadence when he reads a speech, usually only 3 or (possibly) 4 words at a time.  He's not capable of remembering a full sentence, and often his speech cadence cuts sentences short and then they resume.  It seems like he suffers from ADD along with the rest of his obvious afflictions.

I think ALL people in DC should start posting things like this on a regular basis until the GOP gets Trump under control.

If Trump can do it, why shouldn't EVERYONE do it? Flood the system with this sort of thing until DC is forced to create and impose some laws. Let's not allow Trump to be a special case. Drown him out until Trump shuts up.

This is getting ridiculous its over and done with. He says nothing was found but yet a few month later still on it. Im getting sick of Trump only doing or staying things when only its right for him. He has changed by picking and choosing when or what to go to when other presidents have always done.But he feels better then everyone else. He is not making America better.

Absolutely. Have a running count. Baseless twitter number xxx.
But really, he knows they are baseless. He is just feeding falsehoods to his base who will swallow them and spit them back as fact. It is his basic way of doing business.
With a huge lump in my throat and tears streaming from my heart, I so wish you could have more time with your beloved Jason.  Your essay is such an expression of pure love.

Makes me wonder if the Republican plan is to ensure a steady stream of poor people; no access to birth control for poor women, no access to abortion, again, for poor women leaving them the "choice" to raise a child in poverty.  Again with no help.  Just ridicule and patronizing from the government, for making bad choices, for being poor.
Yes, it is the Republican plan.  For them, poverty is a moral problem brought on by being poor, while the rest of us recognize it as an economic problem.

I knew they wanted uncontrolled increases in the poor population in order to have a surplus of cheap labor.  People who would undercut each other and work for less just to have some kind of income.  With our society now, with welfare, food stamps, and fewer jobs for the uneducated, why do the rethuglicans want the poor to have as many babies as possible?  Educated people usually restrict their families to 2-3, because it is so expensive to provide for them, and because when you work it's difficult to give time and attention to more children.

Only when we, and that means our representatives in government, start making decisions based on the realities and constraints of largely predictable human behavior, such as economists do, will we make good use of our dollars. Then we can tackle societal issues in a rational manner with some hope of making progress. Our current obsession and battle over what is moral or right or wrong really has little role in advancing a society toward any functional goal. Absolutes aside, (e.g. murder is wrong),

I really don't believe he understands that he is the President of the Unites States of America.

What's worse is that the Congress is not doing anything about it. This is no longer a partisan fight. It is a fight for the legitimacy of your institutions. Disintegration of your ability to act as a Federal Government does not bode well for American interests abroad.

Reminds me of : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iZ04KhQra6M

Some mental health professionals have stated that Mr. Trump is an extreme narcissist, but not psychologically impaired.

At this point I am truly beginning to wonder, though. He is definitely one of the most narcissistic people I have ever seen. But he also appears to be extremely paranoid and incapable of thinking rationally. And this is the guy America has chosen to be its leader?

Whoa! I think the country in general has finally gone off the deep end. Heaven save the world from us.

You need to read what many say -- the gist of it is that he has not yet shown any clear evidence of harming himself; they do not deny he harms everyone around him.

but I think that the evidence that Trump is harming himself is in front of us all, it's obvious. He is generating enemies at a rate never seen before in American history. He's certain to go down in history as a bone-headed neo-fascist disaster, embarrassment to all of America. That's a form of self-mutilation, but he can't help himself.

Trump is the prototype of a person suffering from projection defense mechanism that Sigmund Freud described at length.

If anyone is a "bad {or sick) guy, it is none other than the man who wrote these lines.

When will the party-ueber-alles Republican's leadership finally admit that the man in the People's House is mentally completely unfit to serve?
Yep, projection you see all what you are in other persons! Mostly all the bad dark side. Like a mirror. Thats the reason he always looks so afraid and angry and thin skin.

Check out Lindsey Graham's talk at Clemson today.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gpdXUeU0nKE&t=233s
When did the troll ever "act Presidential"?  Unless your accent of emphasis is on the word "act".  And if it was acting, then I'd say he was over-rated.
Excellent title,... for a banal claim!
Please...  Someone - anyone - wake me from this nightmare

Stop reading NYT, WaPo, watching CNN (although CNN seemed to pull back and get a little more professional yesterday). Read international news sources (No, not just the Guardian), use google translate if you have to. Look at some conservative and not Total Resistance to Trump sites. You'll get out of the nightmare. It won't get you out of the reality, though.

I'll keep it simple.

The president is dangerously deluded.

What can (or will) anyone do about it?
What will REPUBLICANS do about it?  They own him.  They control both the house and the senate.

Yep. This is exactly what is happening, SG. To the letter. I'm waffling though on whether Trump is crafty or desperate. I mean, it is totally in his wheelhouse to distract and shift attention, but his tweetstorm this morning was so, so ill-advised. It only served to highlight that he was indeed the subject of a FISA warrant, which seems pretty stupid. Wounded animal lashing out?
It's time to seriously consider invoking the 25th Amendment. This man is seriously unhinged.

I've been saying this for a long time, but there's a problem; 25th amendment specifies that it is that is his hand-picked toadies who would need to send a letter in writing to Congress saying that he's gone totally fruit-loops bonkers ... and they aren't going to do that.

Trump could truly be barking at the moon (approximately what he is doing right now), and they wouldn't do that.

The only way to get this guy out is to impeach him. And the only way that will happen is if the Republicans realize that Trump is a bigger danger to them than the cost of impeaching him.

I've given up on the idea that the majority of Republicans are even Americans at heart. They're not, they are only interested in what's in it for them. Trump will get impeached when they realize how dangerous he is to them too, and not a minute before.
His base hates Obama.

Donald is the boy who cried wolf. He lies 74% of the time by actual tally, so when he tells the truth, nobody believes him.

I believe our IC knew the Russians were interfering in the election and talking to Trump associates. He was a private citizen. Why wouldn't they make sure he wasn't selling out the country?

The problem is Comey. We don't know who he is working for. He managed to get Hillary knocked out of the game and when she recovered, he hit her again. He refuses to disclose his Trump investigation to Congress.

Is he playing for Justice? for Donald? or for the Russians? How would we know?

Until the FBI comes clean with their Trump file, we won't know what to believe. This can't continue.
False no proof accusations have been leveled at Trump for the past 2 months.  What makes this any difference? Let's roll on this. Obama is squarely behind this Trump onslaught.

I'm beginning to think the Russians compromised Comey. His actions are consistent with that assessment. Including his recent testimony before the intelligence committee where he was less than expansive of his investigation of Russian influence.
